system.biography:
TitleFFF 804f Gargu-Araki Thief
Birthday2 Nuzyael 712
AppearanceAge 7, height 3’0”, slight frame (size 1), 45 lb, pallid complexion, brown and black hair, black eyes.
Medical/PsycheParasites (fleas and lice, –10 on Rhetoric ML and –20 on Lovecraft ML) /Nymphomaniac (Moderate, test against WIL×3 to resist attempting to seduce females at any opportunity).
Size0
ArmorPlain cloth leggings and leather boots. Knife. If absolutely necessary, Mabresen will reluctantly equip his ward with dagger, shortsword, and bow.
Other EquipmentMay be occasionally found with a potion to aid in his randy escapades.
Valuables
Notes

Biography

Fetch was a spindly runt when he hatched and runts often end up as a meal for other, stronger gargun during lean times. Fetch narrowly avoided the knives of the Gargu-viasal who rule his colony by fleeing into the wilderness. His life would have likely come to an end at the teeth and claws of some wolf or bear but for happy circumstance.

By chance, Fetch found a hut in the woods and the smell of roasting meat was irresistible. Despite his considerable stealth, he was ensnared by a magical ward, for he had unknowingly invaded the hut of Mabresen, a reclusive Fyvrian wizard. The wizard was greatly impressed with the araki’s ability to bypass the many magical and mundane traps defending his hut. He spared the gargun out of genuine curiosity and sympathy for a fellow outcast. Kindly words and food, plus the odd enchantment, convinced the hungry gargun to stay.

What started as curiosity has developed into affection. Fetch has thrived under Mabresen’s nurturing. To the wizard’s delight, the araki’s demeanor differs from his violent kin. Fetch has learned to speak and read Hârnic and has taken to adopting many civilized ways.

The Araki has a phenomenal ability at stealth. He moves as silently as a shadow, is as quick as a hummingbird, can climb as confidently as a spider, and has a cunning sense with traps. Mabresen frequently sends Fetch out to steal away gargun eggs for research.

Although non-violent, Fetch has an overactive sex drive, a source of consternation for Mabresen. Fetch often sneaks off to nearby manors and attempts to “seduce” young maids with love potions stolen from his master’s laboratory, stalking them as they arise early to milk the cows. Failing that, he’ll reluctantly visit the livestock pens for the odd sheep or small pig.

HOOKS

Stag Party! Fetch has filched another love potion and headed to a nearby manor. Mabresen hires the PCs to quietly retrieve his wayward “child” and bring him home safely. However, Fetch has spiked the well and the PCs must disentangle themselves from amorous villagers while trying to find and capture Fetch!

Le Poupée! Fetch is madly smitten with a female PC (or paramour of a PC). Crazy with lust, he will do anything he can to get under her skirt, including drugging everyone so he can enjoy a private, uninterrupted, and wholly gratifying moment with the object of his desire.

Put My Son Down! The PCs somehow captured Fetch, unaware of his civilized ways. If the PCs harm the gargun, despite his pleading in fluent Hârnic, they’ll have to deal with a enraged Mabresen later on.

Credits

This character is taken from “Friends, Foes, and Followers, Part 13” on Lythia.com (https://www.lythia.com/game_aides/fff-gargu/), by Shawn Bond, with illustrations by Richard Luscheck, and is “fanon”, a derivative work of copyrighted material by Columbia Games Inc. and N. Robin Crossby.
